summary: This is an internal FBI email from August 15, 2019, regarding the preparation of a weekly Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) on the Epstein case. The email discusses meeting with a victim and requests specific data on victim outreach and services provided by the Victim Services Division (VSD).

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The email is about preparing a weekly report on the Epstein case, indicating he is the central subject of the investigation.

events.title: FBI meeting with Epstein victim
events.description: An FBI agent states they are headed to meet with an Epstein victim in the afternoon to gather information for a weekly report.

locations: 290 (likely referring to an FBI office location, e.g., 290 Broadway in New York)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein as of August 15, 2019.
The FBI's Victim Services Division (VSD) was tracking victim outreach in multiple locations including New York and Miami.
A weekly Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) was being compiled on the Epstein case, requiring updates on victim counts, services offered, and services accepted.
The email indicates an ongoing, structured investigative and victim support process within the FBI following Epstein's arrest.
